data.title: Great location for our high school reunion.
data.text: This weekend was my high school reunion. We loved the location they chose and enjoyed the drinks and service. The staff was very friendly and took care of us all night

data.title: Old School interior gives a cozy feeling
data.text: We were walking around the SOCO area trying to figure out where we wanted to eat.  There are plenty of options to choose from.  One reason why we chose Florentine's is because they have their menu posted.  There is a front and rear entrance to Florentine's with a rear connection to the Tuscany Club and a front connection to Palapa Grill, both sister restaurants.  The staff took time to warm up but our server, Syerra, was great.  Florentine's has a full bar, some booths, high tables and normal height tables.  The normal height tables are on an elevated platform from the rest of the establishment.  Plenty of wood decor so it can be a bit dark inside with not a lot of natural exterior light coming in.  There are several flat screens present so I can see this place being busy during local college and pro games.  Being there for a Sunday dinner we noticed that a decent number of the patrons appeared to be regulars, some couples, some families.  The dishes we ordered were the Fried Calamari which was tender but appearance was bland; there was no fried color, the batter was cooked (as was the calamari) but the color remained relatively white.  The calamari consisted of thin rings and some tentacles.  Standard would to have a better fried color and to make this dish stand out more Florentine's needs to vary the length of the rings.  Our son could not pass up the Glazed Doughnut Cheeseburger.  We had heard of this combo before but never encountered it so this was an entree that our son could not pass up.  To be honest the doughnut cannot replace a typical hamburger or brioche bun as the doughnut squishes easily and falls apart way too fast.  However the juxtaposition of the normal hamburger ingredients and the sweetness and texture of the glazed doughnut was interesting in a positive way.  The hamburger was tasty and juicy and didn't fall apart as the bottom half of the doughnut did.  Several side options are included with the burger and onion rings were chosen.  These were large and nicely golden crisp unlike the fried calamari.  So the onion rings were good.  The Braised Short Rib was a large block of tender tasty boneless moo with the right balance of fat.  A good-sized serving of coarse mashed potatoes and a skewer with plenty of veggies was included.  Interesting was the side of salad we ordered and called $2 Side Salad but it costs $2.49!  We felt very relaxed at Florentine's and glad we gave them a try.

data.title: Best margarita rocks in town
data.text: I love this place. Melissa is the reason I keep coming back.The food is awesome, happy hour is great,the patrons are fun.....and Melissa is the bomb! This us my favorite stop in Fullerton.

data.title: Olli Concert
data.text: I have eaten here many times, but last Saturday we attended a Music program put on by OLLI and were entertained while we ate.  The food is always very good here and the prices are reasonable.

data.title: they think highly of  themselves
data.text: nothing pecial here...they have some deals but food is same old tastless stuff served statewide. They also have an outdoor area on the corner that they slipped through the city...i wonder how much "slipped " through...it is an illegal encroachment on our downtown sidewalks for their gain..for that i won't go there again..

data.title: more of a bar than a restaurant
data.text: For a bar that serves food you really can't beat this place.. I had the steak sliders and I was totally  surprises. It was excellent. Cooked perfectly and a great value. The service was just as good

data.title: Great Service
data.text: We went in for a late lunch on a Sunday.  There were lots of interesting selections on the menu.  The food was very tasty in a nice atmosphere.  Our server was so professional, helpful, and friendly.  We thoroughly enjoyed it and will go back.

data.title: A Big Time in a Little Downtown
data.text: Florentine's is situated in the heart of downtown Fullerton. One of the last authentic downtown's left in Orange County. They also have an adjacent nightclub, so if you are there on a Friday or Saturday night, expect a lot of foot traffic. The best way to approach the restaurant is to park behind it and go through the back entrance. My husband and I frequent this restaurant for a day night and we have also had family join us for birthday dinners and the like. My favorites on their menu are the cedar planked salmon and the braised short ribs. Their service is always warm and efficient, the atmosphere is a typical grill-house environment, and we are always happy campers when we leave, usually with a doggie-bag in hand.

data.title: SALMON TO DIE FOR
data.text: Brought friends here for dinner and was very happy with the choices and the prices.  We ordered the salmon which was cooked to perfection, juicy and tasty with mango glaze salsa that was so good.  Vegetables were mixed with squash, carrots, and broccoli and cooked to tender but not mushy.  The portions are huge and food arrives hot.  Staff very attentiive.

data.title: Are you Open for Business?
data.text:
New Year's Eve  my party of 4 arrived at 6:00 with a reservation, but found it was not needed (we were the only ones there). We were told to sit where we wanted. Someone bought us water and then nothing. We waited over 15 minutes and then had to get up and ask the 6 waiter/waitress/bartenders, etc for help. A waiter came to our table and apologized over and over and he turned out to be very good, except for not telling us there were specials for the evening (we overheard another table later).  
Our food was good and our waiter offered us a free cocktail for our inconvenience. 
I would probably give the restaurant another chance, sometime. 
The manager needs to have a talk with the wait staff on who covers what tables and to pay attention to the customers.

data.title: Pleasant Surprise
data.text: When we found Florentine's on Trip Advisor, I was looking for a place to relax, top off a pleasant day and possibly get a burger. Sure, why not a bar? When we walked in, it looked like many of the others we had walked past to arrive there. However, when we received our menus and our server, Marissa, greeted us, that all changed. Marissa pointed out that they don't have a cook at Florentine's, but rather, they have a chef. Thoughts of bar burgers and greasy fries went right out the window as she told us the special. My wife had the John Dory fish in a delicious sauce with mashed potatoes and vegetables paired with a white wine. Now, I'm not a fish person, but this could have possibly changed my mind if it wasn't for the ribeye steak I enjoyed. All I can say is "mouthgasm." We topped the meal off by splitting the carrot cake for dessert. It was moist and sweet without being overpowering. If you're looking for a nice dinner, I suggest Florentine's. Crowds vary depending on the night according to what we were told. After all, it is a bar, but go anyway. You're bound to enjoy yourself.

data.title: Its still in business?
data.text:
Came here on a Friday night at 6:00 and there were only a few people in the restaurant, over the age of 60.  They offer tons of coupons and specials, but the place never seems to get full.

Food was ok.  Affordable, and they have a bar next door which also wasn't very busy.

Perhaps its a late night eats place? Or maybe it gets busier on weekends when there's NFL?

data.title: Poor
data.text: Food is meh  . Cheep drinks which you will need several of if you're going to eat the crap they serve here . When is a TV show going to come to this place and fix it ?

data.title: Great Food, Great Prices - Great Value
data.text: The food was excellent; the portions were large; the service was very good.  Will definitely eat there again.

data.title: Enjoyable downtown venue
data.text: I've eaten dinner their several times.  It is in the heart of downtown Fullerton and offers good value.

data.title: cute and great food
data.text: We went for the 2nd time for a family birthday - adults only.  The wait staff and bartender were great, the food was yummy and a nice friendly atmosphere.  We also like that it is primarily a bar and not overly kid-friendly.  The seating could be a little more comfy, but not bad; would definitely go back and recommend.

data.title: Good Friendly Bar and Grill Atmosphere
data.text: The food is excellent.  They offer a variety of $10 meals that includes a soup or salad.  They also offer a variety of premium meals at $15.  More food than you can eat and very good quality and friendly wait staff.

data.title: Very good meal!
data.text: This is a regular for my wife and I.  We love the menu selection and the bartender makes great drinks.  The servers make you always feel welcome.

data.title: We love the barbecue...pasta too. Should list bbq not just italian
data.text: Our party of 10 went in for a birthday celebration. We had bbq ribs that were very meaty and easily came off the bone. Bbq sauce was right on. Sides of onion rings were good and bbq beans were great. Tri tip was also a table favorite. Cream corn was a hit, potato cabbage w blue cheese soup was very good. I know I could have lost a few of you on that one but really it was good. The salad for a buck fifty more was very good size and tasty..green leaf lettuce too. Father in law who is a really picky eater said the chicken pesto was really good. Oh dessert of brownie w ice cream a must. Price was very fair with tons of left overs.

data.title: Down home goodness!!!
data.text: This place is family owned and been in business since the 70's!! Drinks are strong and reasonable. Comfort food at it's finest.
